tailoring: Everyone can benefit from alterations. Clothes tailored to fit look more expensive.
Women: hem lines, pull in waist, shorten sleeves.
Men: tailor suits and shirts for perfect fit.
quality_over_quantity: Buy one quality piece (e.g., cashmere sweater) instead of multiple cheap ones.
fit_rules: A garment must fit the largest part of you; then tailor the rest.
Jackets: always buy ones that can be closed; have shoulders taken in if needed.
Pants: crotch should sit properly without pulling or sagging.
Shirts: collar should allow two fingers when buttoned.
color_mixing: Shoes and bags don't have to match; they have to 'go'.
Brown and black can be mixed in clothing (not accessories).
Use multicolor prints as a guide for accessory colors.
prints_patterns: Match print size to body stature.
Mix patterns by letting one be primary and others supporting.
Animal prints: classic on shoes, bags, pencil skirts; awful on denim, linen, fuzzy slippers.
accessories: Choose accessories proportionate to body size.
Balance statement pieces with minimalist ones.
Belts: add two inches to waist size for correct fit.
Jewelry: bold pieces for tall/bigger frames, delicate for petite.
seasonal_adaptation: Adjust fabrics and weights for season; keep silhouette principles.
For warmer months: lighter fabrics, shorter sleeves, open necklines.
For colder months: layer fitted pieces, use heavier fabrics, add tights/boots.
hosiery: Opaque tights for day, sheer for evening. Never seamed toe with open-toe shoe.
Match hosiery color to skin tone for most natural look.
